content.description: An unusual number of side-pulls, fun holds.
content.location: Two routes right of the water streak/moss. Rap from fixed anchors below the roof.

content.description: Climb the slab and clip the first glue-in where the wall turns vertical. Pull crimps and edges to get to the jugs before the chains.
content.protection: 4 FIXE glue-ins to chains with permanent carabiners.
content.location: As of the FA, this is the left-most route on the wall, and the only truly vertical route on the wall. It is also the only route that climbs under the branches of a tree. It can be distinguished from the other routes by it's FIXE glue-in anchors.

content.description:
Climb up the slab and surmount a short vertical section. Climb through a depression to the overhang. A HUGE cobble sticks out of the wall at your right â€“ climb up and onto the cobble, pull over the bulge and end at chains slightly left.

Getting up onto the cobble is pretty sweet!
content.location: This is the route on the right when looking at the wall.

content.description: Climb through a vertical section (5 bolts) to the long slab above. The route stays left of the roof found directly above "Celsa Vaca" and "That Be Me".
content.protection: 12 FIXE glue-in bolts to glue-in chain anchors. Abut 15' of a 60M rope will be left on the ground after you lower. Tie a knot in the end in case your rope is short!!
content.location: Located left of the water streak on the Billy The Kid wall. Climbs through a brief vertical section (crux) to the long slab above. The cobbles on the upper slab are HUGE!

content.description: First route right of the water/moss streak. The name means "Celsa the Cow", a derogatory name given to a girl rumored to have eyes for Billy the Kid
content.location: First route right of the water/moss streak. Rap from carabiners/fixed anchors under the roof.
